intro: Hieracium sudrei, commonly known as the Sudeten hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It features upright stems with basal leaves and produces yellowish to reddish flower heads. Hieracium sudrei is often considered a weed but plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
